gw.api.builder

Class ClauseBuilder<T extends Bean,B extends ClauseBuilder<T,B,P>,P extends ClausePattern>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.databuilder.DataBuilder<T,B>
      • gw.api.builder.ClauseBuilder<T,B,P>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueGenerator<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoverageBuilder, ExclusionBuilder, PolicyConditionBuilder

    public abstract class ClauseBuilder<T extends Bean,B extends ClauseBuilder<T,B,P>,P extends ClausePattern>
extends DataBuilder<T,B>
    abstract Builder for a Clause (a Coverage, Condition or Exclusion).

    In order to build a Clause you must specify a Clause pattern, either as a ClausePattern or the (String) PatternCode. A typical Clause will have one or more terms associated with it; you would add these terms to the Clause as it is being built. For example:

     new CPBuildingBuilder().withCoverage(
    new CoverageBuilder(CPBldgCov)
        .withPatternCode("CPBldgCov")
        .withDirectTerm("CPBldgCovLimit", 250000)
        .withOptionCovTerm("CPBldgCovDeductible", "500")
        .withTypekeyCovTerm("CPBldgCovCauseOfLoss", CPCauseOfLoss.getTypeKey("Basic"))
        .withBooleanCovTerm("CPBldgCovExcludeVandalism", true))

 new PersonalAutoLineBuilder().withCoverage(
    new CoverageBuilder(PALiabilityCov)
        .withPatternCode("PALiabilityCov")
        .withPackageCovTerm("PACovPack", "250/500/100")
        .withTypekeyCovTerm("PAFullLimitedTort", FullLimitedTort.getTypeKey("limited")))

    The Context in which a Clause would be built is the construction of a Coverable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClauseBuilder

        public ClauseBuilder(IEntityType type)
        Create a ClauseBuilder which will build a bean of the given type
        Parameters:
        type - The IEntityType of the clause being built.

      • ClauseBuilder

        public ClauseBuilder(IType type)
        Create a ClauseBuilder which will build a bean of the given type. If the type is not an EntityType, it uses the supertype, which it assumes IS an entity type.
        Parameters:
        type - The IType of the clause being built.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if neither type nor type.getSuperType() is an IEntityType.

    • Method Detail

      • getPattern

        public P getPattern()

      • withPatternCode

        public B withPatternCode(java.lang.String publicId)
        Looks up a pattern that matches the given string PatternCode. If it finds one, it will use it as the pattern for the Clause being built.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there was no match for the patternCode.

      • getCovTermByDescription

        public CovTermOpt getCovTermByDescription(OptionCovTermPattern<?> pattern,
                                          java.lang.String description)
        Given an OptionCovTermPattern, search for an option with a matching Description.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a duplicate option is detected.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no matching Option.
